properties.areaDesc: Saluda, SC; Lincoln, GA; Edgefield, SC; Newberry, SC; Columbia, GA; McDuffie, GA; McCormick, SC
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 11 at 8:51PM EST until January 11 at 9:30PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Northeastern McDuffie County in east central Georgia...
Northern Columbia County in east central Georgia...
Southeastern Lincoln County in east central Georgia...
Southwestern Newberry County in central South Carolina...
Edgefield County in central South Carolina...
Saluda County in central South Carolina...
Southeastern McCormick County in central South Carolina...

* Until 930 PM EST.

* At 850 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 11 miles south of Ninety Six Historic Site to near
Hamilton Branch State Park to near Appling, moving east at 45 mph.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to
mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings.

* Locations impacted include...
Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, Ridge Spring, Appling, Clarks Hill
Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, Riverwood, Saluda County
Airport, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Monetta, Trenton, Silverstreet,
Ward, Saluda Co Sheriff's Office, Scott's Landing, Northside Fire
Station Main, Belfast Wildlife Management Area, Wildwood Park and
Chappells Fire Station.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EST for east central
Georgia...and central South Carolina.

A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Conditions are
favorable for tornadoes to form.

These are dangerous storms! Prepare immediately for strong winds
capable of producing significant damage. Seek shelter inside a sturdy
building and stay away from windows.
